item.title: Looping over lines in bash
item.description: Recently, I had to write a script that finds files that end in .json but not in examples.json, and renames them. Here is a relevant part of the shell script that uses sed. find . -type f \( -iname "*.json" ! -iname "*.examples.json" \) | while read -r line do out=$(sed 's/.json/.d.ts/g' <<< "$line") echo "$lineconverted to $out" done In another place, I wanted to create a minimal custom CHANGELOG that prints git commits that mention category cool-category in their message (e.
